content.raw:
I'm afraid that we have more problems. [ABI is not fully compatible](https://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/Cxx11AbiCompatibility) when mixing c++11 code and c++98. Debian/Ubuntu are not activating the c++11 flag system wise any time soon, I believe that they are waiting for the compilers to declare a stable ABI point with respect to c++11 ([maybe gcc-4.9](https://lists.debian.org/debian-devel/2013/08/msg00117.html) or above). Seems like problems are not so common, but [it could happen](https://gcc.gnu.org/ml/gcc/2012-05/msg00409.html).

Given the number of libraries used by gazebo compiled using c++98 ([I'm looking specially to boost](http://meetingcpp.com/index.php/br/items/c11-and-boost.html)), I'm not really sure we is going to happen.
